alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 08 at 2:49PM MDT until April 10 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM MDT TO 8 PM MDT SATURDAY EVENING FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS AT AND ABOVE SNOWPACK, DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong westerly winds on Saturday will combine with single digit minimum relative humidities, well above normal temperatures, and an unstable airmass to produce widespread critical fire weather conditions. Critical fire weather conditions will return on Sunday across much the area where several hours of single digit minimum relative humidities and windy conditions will persist. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM MDT SATURDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 1 PM to 8 PM MDT Saturday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect Saturday, but does remain in effect Sunday. * AREA AND TIMING...All Fire Weather Zones except the North Central Mountains Saturday afternoon and early evening and again Sunday afternoon and early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to southwest increasing to 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 40 to 45 mph on Saturday. West to southwest increasing to 25 to 35 mph with gusts of 45 to 50 mph on Sunday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Lowering to 4 to 7 percent Saturday and 6 to 12 percent Sunday. Up to 8 to 12 consecutive hours of single digit minimum relative humidities forecast Saturday and 4 to 8 hours Sunday. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
